meanings.definition: The act of moving or extending in different directions.
meanings.sent1: The river split into two, showing a clear divergence in its path.
meanings.sent2: The divergence of the roads confused the travelers.
meanings.sent3: The divergence of the ants' paths made them look like they were doing a dance.
meanings.sent4: The divergence of their goals led them to different destinations.
meanings.sent5: The sudden divergence of the lightning bolt was a spectacular sight.

meanings.definition: A difference or disagreement between two or more things or opinions.
meanings.sent1: The divergence in their beliefs caused tension in the group.
meanings.sent2: There was a clear divergence in their viewpoints on the matter.
meanings.sent3: The divergence in their tastes for ice cream flavors was comical.
meanings.sent4: The divergence in their stories made it hard to believe either of them.
meanings.sent5: The sharp divergence in their political ideologies was evident during the debate.
